source_status.note: Attachment not present as a local file during build pass; framework derived from provided page images + anchored repo docs.

claims.claim_text: Objective reduction timescale is inversely proportional to gravitational self-energy for mass superpositions.
assumptions: E_G can be estimated for the considered structure
falsifiers: No observed tau scaling with inferred E_G across regimes

claims.claim_text: Microtubule orchestration links coherent windows to ~40 Hz conscious-moment timing in the reviewed narrative.
falsifiers: Lack of repeatable 25 ms periodicity tied to proposed mechanism

claims.claim_text: Mass-superposition energy is represented as E = hbar / t in a collapse-time interpretation.
assumptions: Collapse time maps directly to effective superposition energy
observables: estimated collapse threshold versus dwell time
falsifiers: Energy estimates inconsistent with dimensional checks or measured thresholds

claims.claim_text: KDTLI-like interferometric coherence scales with a log mass-ratio expression used as an argument for macro-molecule coherence.
assumptions: Interferometer expression transfers to biological/stellar analogy
falsifiers: No coherence contrast trend with the proposed scaling

claims.claim_text: Uncertainty relation is used to motivate tunneling-assisted transitions under short time windows.
assumptions: Barrier-crossing regime approximated by uncertainty-limited borrowing
falsifiers: Rates fail to respond to Delta t or barrier parameters as predicted

claims.claim_text: One-dimensional box quantization is used to frame electron localization and resonance states.
assumptions: 1D box approximation is informative for discussed pockets
falsifiers: Measured spectra diverge from n^2/a^2 spacing

claims.claim_text: London-type interaction energy is presented as a coherence-supporting microphysical mechanism.
assumptions: Pairwise London force dominates local interaction
falsifiers: Interaction data incompatible with r^-6 dependence

claims.claim_text: Stochastic Schrödinger evolution is used to model collapse with additive/multiplicative noise and mass-density coupling.
assumptions: CSL-like collapse law applicable in discussed regimes
falsifiers: No differential decoherence under predicted noise coupling

claims.claim_text: Smeared mass density via Gaussian kernel sets spatial correlation length for collapse dynamics.
assumptions: Gaussian smearing is valid effective kernel

claims.claim_text: Lorentzian noise spectrum is proposed to encode quasi-particle memory and resonant poles.
assumptions: Colored noise with resonant structure governs dynamics
falsifiers: No Lorentzian-like peak structure in measured spectra

claims.claim_text: Solar scaling claims use Jeans mass/critical temperature and mass-luminosity relations to connect collapse and stellar structure.
falsifiers: Observed stellar populations violate expected scaling bands

claims.claim_text: Parker wind equations are used as analogical support for steady oscillatory plasma outflow behavior.
claims.equation_text: rho u du/dr = -dp/dr - rho GM_sun/r^2; p=2 rho T / m_p
assumptions: 1D steady hydrodynamic model informative for discussed regime
falsifiers: Profiles incompatible with any admissible Parker branch

claims.claim_text: The review's cross-domain thesis claims mass superposition can sustain coherence in both neural and solar systems, with collapse triggering discrete events.
claims.equation_text: cross-domain mechanism statement (no single governing equation)
assumptions: Shared mechanism across scales despite differing substrates
falsifiers: No shared statistical signature across domains
